Description: Lip sherd of East Greek pottery oinochoe; glaze fired orange-red; interior and exterior glazed; on exterior, from left, in added white, left eye with eyebrow, pinwheel rosette, and dots as filling ornament; ridge near bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the eye, see CVA: Karlsruhe, Badisches Landesmuseum 2, 13, Pl.(344) 46.6. See also British Museum 1886,0401.1052. The style is late Wild Goat or early Fikellura.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.052)
